headline.main: AKYAB IS CAPTURED; Port Is Within 50 Miles of Border -- British at Prome Imperiled WARSHIPS BACKED LANDING 4,000 Burmese Aiding Foe on Irrawaddy Front -- Air Field in the North Is Raided AKYAB IS CAPTURED BY LANDING PARTY

lead_paragraph: CHUNGKING, China, April 2 -- Five thousand sea-borne Japanese troops, heavily escorted by warships, have seized the West Burma port of Akyab, fifty miles from the border of India and 130 miles from the Irrawaddy oil fields, completely outflanking British defenders in the Prome sector, a military spokesman revealed tonight.
